solution.text:
Since the total number of workers = _{{20*j}}_
Workers who leave the team = _{{10*j}}_
Therefore, Workers left for the second time = _{{20*j}}_- _{{10*j}}_ = _{{10*j}}_
Since the numbers of workers and number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional we get,
\( _{{32*k}}_ \times _{{20*j}}_\) = Constant
\(_{{10*j}}_ \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time) = Constant
Therefore,\( _{{32*k}}_ \times _{{20*j}}_ = _{{10*j}}_ \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time)
Number of days to complete job second time =\( \frac {_{{32*k}}_ \times _{{20*j}}_}{_{{10*j}}_} \)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of days to complete the job second time = _{{64*k}}_

content.text: You are a contractor and are given a contract to pave a road. It takes you _{{20*j}}_ trained workers and _{{32*k}}_ days to finish the job. Unfortunately there is a problem and you must redo all the work again. _{{10*j}}_ workers leave your team. How much time will it take the remaining to redo the work and complete the job for a second time?
